info.title: Header Demo API
info.description: An API demonstrating the use of headers in different ways

get.description: This GET request demonstrates the use of custom request headers

parameters.name: X-Custom-Header
parameters.description: A custom header for this request

post.description: This POST request uses a security header for authentication

get.summary: GET request with response headers only
get.description: This GET request returns custom response headers

X-Powered-By.description: Shows which technology powered the request

X-Rate-Limit.description: Indicates the number of requests allowed in a certain time period

expectedSubstrings: getExampleGet( headers?: GetExampleGetHeaders, requestParameters?: Params, ): { response: Response; data: GetExampleGet200; }

response = http.request("GET", k6url.toString(), undefined, { ...mergedRequestParameters, headers: { ...mergedRequestParameters?.headers, // In the schema, headers can be of any type like number but k6 accepts only strings as headers, hence converting all headers to string ...Object.fromEntries( Object.entries(headers || {}).map(([key, value]) => [ key, String(value), ]), ), }, });
postExamplePost( postExamplePostBody: PostExamplePostBody, headers: PostExamplePostHeaders, requestParameters?: Params, ): { response: Response; }

response = http.request( "POST", k6url.toString(), JSON.stringify(postExamplePostBody), { ...mergedRequestParameters, headers: { ...mergedRequestParameters?.headers, "Content-Type": "application/json", // In the schema, headers can be of any type like number but k6 accepts only strings as headers, hence converting all headers to string ...Object.fromEntries( Object.entries(headers || {}).map(([key, value]) => [ key, String(value), ]), ), }, }, );
